abstract: Rebuffing some investors, the 11-member board said that Mr. Dimon should continue to serve as both chief executive and chairman, as he has since 2006.
snippet: Rebuffing some investors, the 11-member board said that Mr. Dimon should continue to serve as both chief executive and chairman, as he has since 2006.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase’s board said on Friday that it was standing behind Jamie Dimon, the bank’s chairman and chief executive, in the face of calls from some investors that the two jobs be split.

headline.main: JPMorgan Board Confirms Dual Role for Dimon
headline.print_headline: JPMorgan Board Confirms Dual Role for Top Executive

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: AMERICAN FEDERATION OF STATE, COUNTY AND MUNICIPAL EMPLOYEES
